title: Pie Chart always calculated to 100 %
body:
Output:
Single – 26.563%             - Reflected as 27% in pie chart
Married – 69.531%          - Reflected as 70% in pie chart
Divorced – 3.906%           - Reflected as 3% in pie chart

I am using v1.5.0 of JFree chart. Please advise.

title: Mouse Zoom only works from top left going down and right
body: What ever happened to this patch from the sourceforge project (https://sourceforge.net/p/jfreechart/patches/281/)? I'd like to initiate the mouse zoom by drawing a box from any corner, no just the top left.

title: Fix XYAreaRenderer to use SeriesFillPaint when not a Gradient
body: If you set SeriesFillPaint with a color that is not a gradient, it will be ignored, and the SeriesPaint will be used instead.

title: Selection zoom strategy implemented to allow changing zooming behavior
body:
Changes in this pull request allow overriding zooming by selecting an area by mouse controller.
Code related to zoom rectangle is moved into a separate class that can be easily overridden.

title: solve the unconsistent comments
Add tests for org.jfree.chart.imagemap.ImageMapUtils
body:
Hi,
I've analysed your codebase and noticed that `org.jfree.chart.imagemap.ImageMapUtils` is not fully tested. Subsequently, I've written tests for the `GetImageMap` function with the help of [Diffblue](https://www.diffblue.com/) [Cover](https://www.diffblue.com/datasheet).

Hopefully, these tests should help you detect regressions caused by future code changes. If you have any other classes you would like additional unit tests for, please let me know and I'll be happy to contribute additional tests.

title: add Catalan translation for JFreeChart 1.0.14
body: use it if you like

title: XYSplineRenderer renders missing values
body: I have a time series chart where some time values can be absent. When using the default renderer, the missing values are correctly *not* rendered: However, when using the ``XYSplineRenderer`` ... with no other change than setting chart renderer to ``new XYSplineRenderer(1)``, the missing values are rendered: In the default ``XYLineAndShapeRenderer``, I can clearly see there is logic in ``drawPrimaryLineAsPath()`` ([here](https://github.com/jfree/jfreechart/blob/master/src/main/java/org/jfree/chart/renderer/xy/XYLineAndShapeRenderer.java#L924-L932)) that's handles missing values, but similar logic is missing from ``XYSplineRenderer`` (which overrides that method).

title: Gradle build with Java 11 fails
body:
Building our Gradle project with Java 11 and JFreeChart dependency fails:
```
> Task :nemclient:compileJava
error: clone() in AbstractXYItemRenderer cannot implement clone() in PublicCloneable
attempting to assign weaker access privileges; was public
```
The solution proposed in pull request #112 would solve the problem.

title: Support for time series diagram with trilean values
body:
Trilean values can be displayed by chart software in principle.
I hope also that ternary data can be configured and presented in more convenient ways for clearer diagrams of multiple time series.

* [Variations exist for the representation of this data type](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three-valued_logic#Representation_of_values "Description for three-valued logic").
  Can any known conversions become built-in for such input data?
* Intermediate increments should not be displayed as in comparison to regular line chart types.
  [Specific lines or filled rectangles should be shown in lanes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_timing_diagram "Example for a digital timing diagram").

title: Use jfreechart drawing function, CPU usage increased by 25%
body:
When we used jfreechart to draw a histogram, I found that my PC CPU share increased by 25%.
This issue does not exist when using version 1.0.13 and earlier, and there is such a question in versions after 1.0.19.
The same issue exists with the demo test of jfreechart, so I think this is a major problem.
I want to know if there is a solution or a planned solution for this issue.

title: StackedAreaRenderer oddity
body: There seems to be an oddity with StackedAreaRenderer when multiple datasets go to zero at the same category.  When my low point for a StackedAreaRender is not 0.0 the plot that is produced looks fine. The issue that I'm having comes in when I have data that has a low point of 0.0. The issue draws the filled area halfway between the next two categories and makes the plot look off.  [Example code](http://www.jfree.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=120342&p=187348) for runnable version of oddity.  The work  around I'm currently using is to check for zero and replace 0 with Math.ulp(1.0) to give the value a non zero value but visually a zero value.

title: Removal of AbstractObjectList
body: Is it possible to remove the AbstactObjectList and replace it's Direct Known Subclasses (BooleanList, ObjectList, PaintList, ShapeList, StrokeList) with ArrayLists of the List types?  This would help make the code slightly easier to read and understand; as well as, use the provided ArrayList class as the backing class vs a self made class that emulates it now.

title: setHeadPercent does not check whether percent is legal
Overlap detection for item labels
body:
I'm rendering line chart into image.
Line chart has multiple series.
Some series contain same values.
I mark shapes and labels to show.

Is there something i can do with overlapping labels in line chart (time or xy)?

My only current option is change ```ItemLabelPosition``` by iterating series and adjust ```ItemLabelAnchor``` and ```TextAnchor``` for each serie. But lines are random and there are situations where labels can be on top of each other even if they were adjusted.

```
for (int i = 0; i < timeSeriesCollection.getSeriesCount(); i++) {
      renderer.setSeriesPositiveItemLabelPosition(i, new ItemLabelPosition(getLabelAnchor(i), getTextAnchor(i)));
}
```

title: The reserved method does not throw exceptions for illegal cases
setTickLabelFont is not respected for LogAxis if setNumberFormatOverride is used
Automatic module name
body:
As described by [Mak Sander](http://branchandbound.net/blog/java/2017/12/automatic-module-name/) we should add the automatic module name entries to the manifest. 
This would really help in jdk9 builds using this library.

title: gray shade on jfreechart when scroll the swt Scrollcomposite
Crashes when testing CompassPlot
body:
**jfreechart Version:** 1.5.0
**Operating System:** Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS, McOs High Sierra (version 10.13.5)
**Machine:** single machine (laptop)
**Junit version:** 4.12

### Steps to reproduce
Please run the attached test suite for the class `org.jfree.chart.plot.CompassPlot`:
[CompassPlotTestSuite.txt](https://github.com/jfree/jfreechart/files/2245878/CompassPlotTestSuite.txt)


### Context:
The tests I provided come from a static analysis prototype I have been working on as part of a research project. The tool analyses a specified dependency of a project to identify risky API calls which may potentially lead to runtime exceptions. Runtime exceptions may occur either because 1) an API is lacking sufficient documentation, or 2) usage of the API does not conform to the specification, or 3) API wrapper does not indicate the API specification as part of its own specification. The prototype then automatically generates test cases which show how such exceptions may be triggered.

I have been evaluating the tool on various open source projects. In the case of `jfreechart-1.5.0`, `JDK API` calls are analyzed. Each provided test case triggers a unique crash due to how data are forwarded to `java.util.ResourceBundle.getString`.

### Possible fixes
The declaration of `CompassPlot.localizationResources` should be final so that it can not be changed.
